inn1.comm: full outside off, hint of swing back in at Roy, left alone
angled across outside off this time, through to the keeper
big appeal for lbw as Roy plays across the line, might have been heading down leg...could have pitched outside leg, too
some luck, playing a forcing shot off the back foot and gets an inside edge which scoots over the stumps and past the keeper
on a length at middle, 85mph, defended towards midwicket
nicely bowled, pushes this one across on a full length, takes a thick outside wide of second slip
that's a rifled straight drive, beautiful looking stroke, and it crashes into the non-striker's stumps...nearly confusion as they try to steal a single. Not far from Gul's fingertips
back of a length, defended
back of a length, Roy picks it up with a front-foot pull. Not that far from midwicket, but he got a decent chunk of it
short again, this time he rolls the wrists and pull is it very fine towards one of the short boundaries. Poor delivery
back on a full length outside off, defended to the covers
back of a length, he goes for another pull but this skids on a touch more and defeats the strike, taking him in the stomach
full outside off, pushed firmly towards mid-off...that was Hales' first ball
wider outside off, Hales chases it with a cover drive, doesn't come out of the middle and the outfield is fairly slow after the rain but it still trickles to the rope
full outside off, he plays another drive and miscues it back to the bowler
keeping it full, not moving much, punched back towards the bowler
back of a length at off stump, 87mph, driven to the covers
swing and a miss as Hales goes after a short-of-a-length delivery, aiming to pull, and the ball goes over the top of middle stump
back of a length, he closes the face and works it into square leg
length delivery, doesn't quite bounces as Hales expects, jabbed to the leg side
that's a terrific shot, it was a short-of-a-length delivery outside off and he just manages to get over the top of the bounce and placed it square through the off side
angled in at the body, flicked with a straight bat to midwicket
another good piece of timing, flicks another short-of-a-length delivery between midwicket and mid-on...was in the air for a while, but very safe
gets it fuller, nips back off the seam and takes Roy high on the pad
that's dismissed by Hales, full outside off and he launches into a lovely drive between cover and mid-off

another drive, another boundary...this one was in the air for a while as it went square of the wicket through point but he found the gap. Was quite to the pitch this time and playing away from the body
drags the length back, Hales flashes hard and gets a thick top edge which flies of first slip (second slip had just come out to plug the off side)
switches to round the wicket, Hales is forward again and drives to the covers

picks out mid-on! Amir gives Hales a few words. A full ball, Hales goes for another drive, the bat twists a little in his hand and he mistimes a simple catch to Malik. Amir cut his fingers across the ball, so credit to him as well
pushed across full outside off, left alone
starts with an lbw appeal, not a million miles away, and it glances away off the boot to fine leg
angled in at the pads again, deflects away to square leg
comes forward to a full ball outside off, it nips back and takes a thick inside edge
straight delivery, played to midwicket
gets right across his stumps, a full straight delivery, flicks down to long leg
length ball at off stump, 80mph, defended to mid-off
flicks this off the pads wide of square leg
well bowled, back of a length outside off, comes back off the seam and beats the inside edge...think Roy was going to leave that to start with
full outside off, thick inside edge to midwicket as he drives
nudges this into square leg
walks forward into a full ball and plays it to the left of mid-off to get off the mark
back of a length, chopped down wide of the slip
comes forward, closes the face on a length ball, it runs wide of square leg
shaping in at the pads, bobbles to the leg side
opens the face down to third man...England's fifty inside eight overs
that's a very neat shot, punches off the back foot wide of mid-off, nice piece of timing and it keeps running away from the fielder who just manages to flick it back
tries to whip this from well outside off to the leg side with plenty of bottom, just gets it behind square
back of a length, doesn't quite get up, takes the toe end of the bat towards cover
back of a length at off stump, 81mph, driven to mid-on
short of a length, drags it from outside off to deep square leg
punched to mid-on
lovely stroke, latches on to a short ball and pulls it handsomely over square leg...he had so much time to play that stroke
outside off, short of a length, nips back a touch, Root takes his bottom hand off the bat as the ball slides off the face to third man
on the pads, flicked behind square with the timing and placement to beat deep square...poor stuff from Gul
big wicket! Root going for a drive, gets an inside edge which demolishes leg stump...Root indicates the ball just nipped back a touch.
back of a length, defended to the bowler
full and straight, flicked strong to mid-on...a belated, TV call, of no ball
and it costs a boundary as Morgan pings a full delivery straight down the ground...that sounded sweet
at off stump, defended
slides past the outside edge as Morgan pulls his bat inside the line...doesn't carry to Sarfraz on the full
nearly edges to gully, Morgan going for a drive to quite a wide delivery but the thick edge falls just in front
full outside off, opens the face to third man
angled across outside off, left alone
hanging it outside off, through to the keeper
full outside off, Morgan comes forward then leaves alone
and again, Morgan happy to have a few sighters outside off
this time he doesn't leave it alone, touch shorter and wider, he cuts it firmly behind point...undoes the good work of the over
a thunderous straight drive as Hasan overpitches, Roy strides forward and powers it straight of mid-off
edged! Wide of first slip. Not sure Roy was in control of that one. A length ball outside off, yeah that was a genuine edge I reckon
pushed square to point
back of a length outside off, he leaves it alone
that's a good delivery, full outside off and moves away late to defeat Roy's drive
full at off stump, a solid front-foot push towards mid-on
back of a length, defended to the off side
shovels this from outside off wide of mid-on with plenty of bottom hand
round the wicket, outside off, left alone
uses his feet but the delivery is quite wide outside off and he ends up mistiming to the leg side
width outside off, cuts and beats a diving backward point
angled in at the pads, sweetly timed flicked to deep square leg
round the wicket, full outside leg, Roy's sweep picks out short fine leg
flicked off the stumps towards midwicket
short, wide outside off, cut to deep point
outside leg stump, goes for a sweep and it takes the pad
uses his feet, Malik drags the length back, flicked through the leg side and a fumble in the deep ensures the two is easy
takes a thick leading edge to the off side and they nearly run into each other but safe in the end
round the wicket, full and straight, pushed to long-on
stays round the wicket, pushed back to the bowler
well, my goodness! Morgan has come down the pitch and driven a full toss straight back to Imad. Off the bottom of the bat. Soft dismissal
full outside off, he's off the mark with a neat push through the covers
nicely bowled, held back a fraction, Roy pushes through the covers
full outside off, blocked to the covers
gets away with a top edge, Roy goes for the reverse sweep and it loops tantalisingly out of reach of the fielder...runs to third man and take Roy to fifty
pushed back to the bowler
flicks a short ball through square leg
round the wicket, slides on with the arm, defended to the leg side
pushes a full ball towards cover
defends a straight delivery
flicked off the pads to deep square...brings up England's 100 at a good rate, although they have shipped three wickets
defended to the off side
tight on off stump, played back down the pitch
lovely bowling and a missed stumping as he draws Stokes down the pitch, the ball grips and spins between bat and pad. Beats Sarfraz as well
touch shorter, punched to the leg side
quicker ball pushed across outside off and it beats Stokes top edge as he cuts...good over
flat and fired on middle, defended
slides onto the leg stump, he goes low and sweeps it away to the fine leg fence
another non-turning ball, on the stumps, flicked out to midwicket
no turn for Malik, skids on, Roy sweeps again. This time he finds short fine leg
pushed through, Roy nips down the track and shovels it in the air... evades midwicket diving to his right. It was not far away from him
glanced off the pads square through the leg side
goes on with the arm outside off, leans back and chops towards backward point
full and straight, nicely driven to long-on with a straight bat

an appeal for lbw, looks quite close, but not given by the umpire Simon Fry. Pakistan want a review. Another one that slides on, no turn, nearly 90ks, Stokes  shapes to reverse sweep and takes it on the thigh.Replays show that it had pitched just outside leg Pakistan lose their review. It would have trimmed the bails, but that does not matter
pushed through outside off, pokey drive to the covers
Stokes keeps back and runs this from outside off to short third man
picked off the pads through the midwicket region
tossed on middle, driven down the ground off the inside half
Roy skips down the pitch and flicks through midwicket
skidder at off stump, Stokes camps back and shovels it down to long-on
sliding on middle and leg, goes low, and paddles it squarer of short fine leg
Roy sees some flight, he wades down the track again. Nonchalantly launched it over long-on, in front of the sightscreen. First six of the game
heading down leg, beating the sweep, Sarfraz collects the ball
picked from the leg stump and drilled to deep backward square leg with a sweep
non-turning ball outside off, punched out through extra cover
hint of spin into the left hander, poked back to Imad off an inside edge
darted onto the thighs, Stokes goes deep in the crease and whips it away behind square
drifts into the right-hander and then turns away, check-dabbed towards point. There is a brief mix-up. Stokes wants a single, Roy doesn't. Stokes it sent back. He makes it with a full-stretch dive
arm ball which arrows in with the angle at a quicker pace, Roy jabs an inside edge onto the pad
pushed down the ground for a single
clipped off the back foot through square leg
hurled into the pads, kept low as well. Stokes goes low with it and keeps it out
tucked around the corner for another single
Roy uses his feet again, this is dangled on the leg stump. Flicked square through the leg side
slid through on leg from round the stumps, swept to short fine leg
I think that died a few centimetres in front of short fine leg. Imad throws his head back in disappointment. Dipping full toss on the leg stump, nearly paddled it to the fielder
slider on middle, punched on the back foot to midwicket
down the track and quietly played back to the bowler
whipped away through midwicket as it skids on again
flighted on the off stump, spins a touch, sliced away to point off an outside edge
Roy shows his ace early by charging at Imad. He pulls his length back and keeps the right-hander to a defence
smoothly driven down to long-off for one
fired just outside off from round the stumps, Roy goes low, sweeps and misses. Malik appeals. The ball kissed the thigh on its way to the keeper. Good call from the umpire
smokinn! Roy steps away outside leg, Malik follows him and pushes it fuller. Biffed straight down the ground for six
Roy makes room again, Malik chases him and fires it quicker. This is not as full as the previous one. Dragged to wide long-on
dabbed gently to point
slides on, jams an inside edge onto the pad
pushed through on middle, tapped into the covers
slapped from outside off to the covers
slides at off stump, blocked
more loopier and outside off, front-foot drive back to the bowler
floated on a fourth-stump line, forward and patted to the off side
tossed up beautifully, grips in the surface, and turns, catching the outside edge, which skitters through vacant slip
hurled down leg, wide
pushed through, no turn, chopped away to cover
good length and angling away outside off, glided down to point
Amir drags his length back and bowls it on the leg stump, worked behind square
shorter and outside off, short-arm pulled away to deep midwicket
shortish and slanting across the right-hander, helped down to third man
shorter and just a shade outside off, forced down to long-on. 150 up and that's warmly applauded by the crowd
length ball at off stump, guided down towards point
finds spin rightaway but the length is shorter, making things easy for Stokes. He goes back and punches to midwicket
skids on with the arm on the stumps, reverse swept wide of backward point. That was tinged with risk
pushed through on middle, down the track and clouted down to long-on. That was not far away from the non-striker
flighted on the off stump, Stokes ventures down the track, goes with the spin, pinging over long-on for six. Stokes needed that release
tapped into the covers
slides on quickly outside off, Roy plays for the turn where there is none and is beaten
Stokes runs at Amir and clears mid-on! He ended up dragging it over the fielder as opposed to timing it. Amir has a wry smile, he knew he had a chance
back of a length on middle, patted to mid-on
Amir comes back and hoodwinks Roy! Slower-ball bouncer cuts away from the batsman outside off, 129ks, Roy was early into the shot. He pulls and sends a top edge to Hasan Ali at deep square leg
back of a length and zipping in, Amir cranks it up to 140.3ks, beats the inside edge
length ball on off, YJB tips forward and blocks it back to the bowler
dug in short on off, Bairstow gets on top of the bounce and controls a pull in front of square
fired on the leg stump, inside-edged onto the pad
sliding outside leg, whipped to short fine leg
good length and spins in, Stokes manages an inside edge onto the pad. Ricochets to cover
slides on outside off, punched through extra-cover
flicked around the corner for one
straight delivery, blocked with a straight bat
pitched up on off, pushed towards mid-off
banged in short at 142.6ks, rushes Stokes into a pull and socks him on the stomach. Ouch!
short on the stumps, Stokes succeeds in pulling this time. Controlled to deep midwicket
YJB rises on top of this short ball outside off and quells it to the short extra cover region
back of a length and slanting away, skewered into the covers
back of a length and slanting away outside off, dabbed down to point
slides on middle stump, defended back to the bowler
Bang! Stokes comes down the track again, marmalises it over long-off for another six. He's exploiting these straight boundaries
fired on middle, squeezed through the covers
down the track again, this is now belted down the ground to long-on
slower through the air on middle, dips, creating some distance between the bat and the pitch. YJB aims a leg-side flick and gets a leading edge in front of extra cover
heading down the leg side, Stokes can't shovel it to fine leg. Wide
pretty full on off, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
length ball on off, YJB looks for a muscular tug over midwicket. He ends up skewing an inside edge, past the leg stump, to fine leg
length ball on middle and leg, punched with a straight bat down the ground
Crunchy! Hasan over-shoots this full ball outside off, YJB leans into it and times the drive past the covers
back of a length and angled into the hips, turned through backward square leg. He hurtles back for the second
short and cramps the batsman for room, played to point
good length ball on middle, punched down to mid-on
pushed through on middle and leg, whipped through the square-leg region
floated up, Bairstow misses the ramp. Pitches outside and hits the pad outside the line of off
chopped from off stump past cover
down the track, the bowler shortened his length. Check-pushed to mid-off
slides on outside off, cracked through extra cover
Stokes backs away outside leg and slaps it away to cover, where the fielder fumbles, allowing a single. He had a bad bounce there
fiercely short-armed away! Good length and just a shade outside off, YJB smites it over wide mid-on
dropped short on off, the change-up does not matter. No violence, here, though. Bairstow swivels on the back foot and neatly pulls behind square
back of a length on middle, hangs back and defends
back of a length and outside off, he moves away, hunts for a glide to third man. No dice
Another fielding mishap. Sharjeel mis-times the dive from short fine leg and messes up. Sloppy stuff. This was picked away behind square on the leg side
back of a length, YJB presses forward and defends to cover, and that's drinks
full from round the wicket, flicked down the ground
driven to long-off
short on the pads, flicked out to deep midwicket
nearly gets a leading edge to the bowler as tries to work a ball off his pads
opens the face and pushes square to point
quicker, a slider, Bairstow goes back and plays to the covers...Imad keeps up his good work
on a length at off stump, pushed into the mid-on area
full and straight, clipped to midwicket
charges down the pitch then loses his shape on the shot as he heaves to the leg side
short delivery, he goes for the hook and ends up down on his back knee after making connection...scoops it towards long leg
length ball outside off, driven to cover, who then throws at the stumps, hits, and the ball scoots away for an overthrow...batsman well home
another short delivery which he flat-bat pulls to deep square
pushed down to long-off
backs away outside leg to open up the off side, then misses as Imad pushes the ball across him
straighter delivery, stays in line, nudges back to the bowler
moving outside leg again, heaves this down to long-on
appeal for lbw as Bairstow plays around a full delivery...looked fairly close. Actually, heading leg side
that's turned squared! Lovely delivery, grips from around off stump and beats the outside edge by a long away
man down! Stokes goes for the pull and gets a bottom edge into his box. Goes down in the crease, then walks away to compose himself. Bairstow smiling, Root giggling on the balcony. Count 'em, Ben
full and straight, punched sweetly into midwicket so he gets off strike...still slightly eye-watering for Stokes
dragged down on off stump, a slower long hop, and crunched over midwicket

good response by Gul, bangs this in short again, cramps Bairstow for room as he looks to ramp it down to third man and ends up splicing it up to backward point. May have taken some glove first. Yes, went off glove then onto the face of the bat
length ball outside off, takes a thick outside edge along the ground to third man
full outside off, whipped strongly straight to midwicket and Stokes has to get the dive out...not what he needed after the blow earlier in the over
full outside off, a clean strike down the ground, skims across the boundary, and takes him to another fifty...63 balls
flatter, quicker, pushed back to the bowler
worked off the pads to deep midwicket
full outside leg, clipped behind square
moves outside leg then chops the ball into the ground off the bottom
on the pads, flicked to short fine leg
pushed into the covers
short of a length, gets inside the line and works to deeps square leg
gets hold of a length ball outside off and fetches it through midwicket with a crunching pull which goes wide of long-on
a very short bouncer, and it's called wide
short of a length, plays a crouching pull, travels quickly towards Amir at short fine leg who can't stop it cleanly
another bouncer, Stokes lets it go through and gains another wide call
that's dismissed out of the ground...uses his feet then connects sweetly with a full delivery and heaves it over wide long-on
goes full and straight, flicked through the leg side with excellent placement as he splits deep square and deep midwicket
round the wicket, short outside off, cut to point
straighter delivery, goes back and punches to deep cover
backs outside leg stump, Nawaz follows him, Stokes pulls down to long-on
opens the face and steers this to deep cover
big full toss, Stokes brings out the reverse sweep and sends it through backward point...could have put that anywhere in the ground
poor ball, pushed down the leg side, Stokes catches up with and glances very fine past the keeper...a new career-best for Stokes. Chance of a hundred
full at off stump, pushed to deep cover...feeding the strike back to Stokes
low full toss, a slower ball, Stokes swings it away towards deep square
full and straight, driven to long-on
picks out short fine leg! No century for Stokes. Moves across outside off stump, trying to scoop this, doesn't get it high enough to clear the fielder
tucks this off his pads to deep midwicket and that's swift work between the wickets
full at off stump, driven firmly to mid-off
back of a length, angled across outside off, guided to third man
tight to Woakes, no width to work with, chops to backward point
full, drives in the air, out of reach of cover and wide of the sweeper who is Sharjeel and not the quickest
short delivery, neatly worked off his hip to the leg side
short of a length, goes for the pull, gets a bottom edge into his hip...less painful than the Stokes blow
short again, a slightly slower ball, Woakes pulls well in front of square to deep midwicket
drives a fraction early at this but manages to clear the bowler and it's actually struck pretty well and scoots down the ground
dragged on! Pakistan keep chipping away. A slower ball outside off, Woakes early on his drive and gets an inside edge into the timber
pushed across full outside off, Willey nearly feels for
length ball on off stump, defended
full, wide outside off, Willey throws his hands through a drive and gets it over backward point
a yorker, well bowled, dug out to the off side
some delicate touch from Dawson as he opens the face and glides this fine of third man
short of a length, takes the thigh pad to the leg side

and another one goes...Amir takes his third. A short ball, hurries Dawson as he goes for the pull, it goes straight up the air and midwicket just has to take a few steps to his right to take the catch
well bowled, short of a length, angled across at 88mph, climbs past the outside edge as Jordan plays inside the line
full this time, driven firmly to cover
back of a length, pushed square towards point where Rizwan gets a rough bounce off an old wicket end
full and straight, Jordan aiming to the leg side and nearly gives a leading edge back to the bowler
almost another drag on, back-of-a-length delivery, takes a thick inside edge to the leg side
short outside off, Willey plays over the top of the ball
full at off stump, pushed to the covers...excellent stuff from Hasan
a short ball this time, angled across outside off, Willey lets it through to the keeper...perhaps was hoping for the wide
goes for the hook this time, ball falls short of Babar out at deep square leg...another good over
excellent short ball, 86mph, over off stump, Willey has to quickly pull his body out of the line
fuller, worked off the pads into midwicket
short of a length outside leg stump, clipped to long leg
terrific delivery, a yorker spearing in at off stump, all Willey can do is keep it out
aims for another yorker, a low full toss this time, but just a single as Willey clips to deep square
rolls his wrists and tucks this off his pads behind square
back of a length, played into midwicket
tight on off stump, Jordan can't get it away, pushes towards mid-off
a short ball, over off stump, Jordan ducks and it's another dot ball
gets onto leg stump, clipped to long leg
full outside off, he swings through the line but it's just a single to long-on
a slower short ball, 79mph, Jordan is through his shot early...just two off the over
and strikes again...a short ball, another slower one, Willey connects quite cleanly but doesn't get the distance and picks out deep square leg
an appeal for lbw but that's missing leg stump as it nips into the pads...Hasan searching for his five-wicket haul
that's a useful edge from Wood, short and some width outside off, takes the top edge as Wood pushes hard at it
throws his hands through a full ball this time, good-looking shot to deep cover
back of a length at off stump, pushed into the covers where the fielders are hanging back
full outside off, driven to mid-off and he'll keep the strike for the final over
goes for the pull and this falls short of deep square running in off the boundary
that's a mighty blow! Jordan goes downtown as Gul offers him a full delivery, a powerful strike straight down the ground. Into the river?
swing and a miss at a shorter, slower ball...through his shot
short outside off, dragged over midwicket and that brace is enough to take England to 300...been harder work than they might have thought 10 overs ago
connects cleanly with this pull, another delivery dug in at 73mph, and it skims to deep square leg
short again, goes for the pull, think they may have come off his helmet and they scamper through

inn2.comm: full and straying into the pads, clipped behind square for three
full and angled across the left-hander, left alone
back of a length and outside off, slashed down to third man
back of a length and goes straight on, pushed to mid-on
neither too short nor too wide to warrant a cut, chopped to covers as Azhar was tucked up for room
good length ball on middle, blocked
slightly short and width outside off, warm-up ball, Sharjeel cuts firmly but finds backward point
much better! Willey pitches it much fuller outside off and finds a hint of awayswing, left alone
back of a length and slanting away outside off, not all that short, he aims an almighty an almighty pull only to connect with thin air
back of a length on off, blocked
full outswinger, draws a willy-nilly waft from Sharjeel. Beats the outside edge lavishly
good length and largely holds its line outside off, he deliberately plays inside the line of it
back of a length and no swing for Woakes. Jabbed from outside off to the covers
similar length, but closer to off. Punchily blocked to short cover
Woakes tests Azhar with a short ball on middle, Azhar pulls feebly and ends up fluttering it over Dawson at short midwicket
full and seams in, the inside edge sneaks to fine leg
stylishly done! Length and outside off, Sharjeel picks it away past Stokes, directs it to the square-leg fence
full and leaves the left-hander in the channel outside off, whistling past the outside edge
veering into the hips, glanced away fine of short fine leg. He can't cut it off, despite a dive. First four for Azhar. First runs off Willey
good length and angled outside off, Azhar covers his off stump and lets it go
banged in short on leg stump, cramps him for room, fended towards midwicket
back of a length and outside off, punched crisply to cover
swinging down the leg side, sharp take from YJB, diving to his left
Azhar shimmies out, Willey drags his length back, and gets it to skid into the batsman. He aims to flick and tickles an inside edge onto the thigh and gets one
dug in outside off at 143ks, but Sharjeel has time to swivel pull to fine leg
pitched up and outside off, Sharjeel loves that pick-up pull but the length is nowhere near short. He jams an inside edge onto the pad
keeps it full and outside off, better shot selection. Presses forward and drives to mid-off
near off-stump yorker, kept out
too full and outside off, Sharjeel brings his bottom-hand into play and muscles it over mid-off
this is just shovelled into the lap of mid-on! Woakes lands it full and just outside off, Sharjeel stays back and aims to clear mid-on. No dice. He just scoops it up and spoons it to Wood
good length on off stump, defended
chopped from off stump to cover, no room to free the arms
full and attacking off again, bit of inswing, defended
back of a length and angling away, Azam presses forward and punches to cover
short and rises on off, the batsman rises tall and forces to  mid-off
Azam threads the little gap between the covers and mid-off. Fullish and outside off, he has a short stride as he drives a boundary
just shading outside leg, Azam can't tickle it away. Wide
short angled at off stump, chopped from there to the off side
good length and outside off, angled out towards point
length and outside off, takes it on the up and drives it to cover
length ball on middle and leg, kerplunked through square leg
full at off stump, tip-and-run single to point. Good intent. Refreshing
slightly short and outside off, sits up, Azhar pulls it in front of square. Smartly done
back of a length and outside off, run away wide of backward point

slightly short and outside off, timed square through the off side. Beautifully punched away between backward point and the man at cover. Yikes, Azam slips and nearly rams into Willey. He takes sometime to compose himself
hops, skips and tucks off the hips behind square
wide-ish line, helped down to third man
picked off the pads to backward square leg
shortish and outside off, swatted to Root at short midwicket
back of a length on middle, leaps and secures another quick single in front of point
that's su-weet! Back of a length and outside off, leans back and punches it square through the off side
much wider outside off, cutter, gently run down to the third-man fence
good length on off, defended back to the bowler
Morgan flings to his right from mid-off and cuts it off. Half-volley outside off, crunched down the ground
back of a length on middle, dabbed with soft hands behind square on off. He looks for a quick single, but eventually decides against it
sliding into the pads, glanced fine on the leg side for another boundary. Pakistan are cranking up the tempo
back of a length and angled in from over the wicket, blocked
back of a length on middle, deflected past lone slip, towards third man
threads the off-side infield again! Rises on top of a short ball outside off and punches in the gap at the covers. Lovely sound as the bat met the ball
short at off stump, swat-pulled away to short midwicket
short and wide outside off, he has a proper go at it. Slashing it over the top of slip for four
back of a length and outside off, forced to cover-point
full and swings away a touch outside off, slices a drive to backward point after reaching out
back of a length and outside off, directed down to third man
dug in short on off, the batsman has time to roll his wrists and swivel-pull to deep square leg
length ball angled in on off, nudged to leg
slower short ball outside off, offcutter, grips in the surface. Flat-batted away to mid-on
leg-stump line, eased down to long leg
length and outside off, sliced away to the right of backward point
length and outside off, jabbed into the covers
full and outside off, rocks forward and caresses a drive through extra cover. Charming stroke
pitched up on the stumps, Azam targets the leg side but ends up dribbling a soft leading edge back to Wood
quite close to the off stump, he swings his hands at a cut and ends up chopping to point
length and outside off,  he aims to cut and misses
driven to the left of mid-on for four! Nice way to raise the fifty stand. Overpitched on the stumps, drilled away past the diving fielder
Stokes pulls his length back on middle, played back to the bowler
Stokes goes wide of the crease and angles it on off and middle, pushed to mid-off on the front foot
fuller and outside off, the batsman shapes to whip it away and ends up getting an outside edge that rolls to third man
slower short ball outside off, forced away to deep square leg with a pull
overpitched and wide outside off, reaches out for a drive. Sliced to deep point, the man at backward point dived and deflected it away
length and outside off, placed through the covers with an open face
back of a length and skids on quickly at off, defended

cleaned 'em up! Wood revvs up his car and rides it through the gate of Azam. Tactful use of the crease, he went wide of it and unleashed an inducker at 142ks. Beats the batsman, who aimed a drive, on the inside, and splatters the middle stump
length and outside off, steered down to third man

an appeal for caught behind, not given by umpire Fry. YJB almost immediately signals for a review. Suggests there was some bat there.There was a noise as the ball ran past the bat, and snicko detects a spike. Azhar has to exit. Two wickets in three balls for Wood! Banged in short and outside off, Azhar was caught between pulling and leaving. He does a bit of this and a bit of that. Looks highly ungainly. Grazes the top edge (a very thin one) and settles into the gloves of YJB
speared full at off, push-driven to mid-off. End of an impactful over
short and angled in, Malik hops and diffuses the potential dynamite in front of point
length and outside off, Malik dabs down to third man for one
length ball on off, Sarfraz keeps back and blocks
full and outside off, clunks a drive to point
length ball on off, angled out to point. Sarfraz keeps searching for the single square through the off side
full and outside off, impressively driven through extra cover, there is protection in the deep
full and just outside off, driven to cover
Sarfraz ventures wide outside off, Wood angles it in, outside leg. Just a shade outside leg. Wide
back of a length nip-backer, grazes the inside edge as the bat comes down at an angle. The ball rolls to fine leg
kicking short ball on off, hops and fends to cover
predictably short on the stumps, Malik hops in defence
goes wide of the crease from round the stumps and sends down another short ball, the line is on the leg stump, glanced away towards fine leg
pitched up and outside off from over the stumps to Sarfraz, a busy drive through the covers is his response
nearly drags on...defended a length ball with soft hands, it bounces into the pitch and then bounces over the stumps
upper cuts a shorter delivery high over backward point, Hales runs around from third man
well bowled again, in a good grove here, nips back from a short of a length and strikes Malik on the bottom hand
on off stump, 83mph, defended a little uncertainly to mid-on
he clips the stumps in his delivery stride, so that's a no-ball...was with his bowling hand
low full toss outside off which gets carved down to third man...attempted slower ball, I think. Batsman's game
dropped, but it was a stinging chance to Root at short cover as Malik drove firmly on the up
back of a length outside off, dropped into the covers and it's a well-judged single
that's an excellent pull shot as Wood drops short, pinged in front of square...that will be a confidence-booster
gets away with it this time, another short ball - quicker this time - and he pulls again, comes off the splice of the bat but falls safely into midwicket
steered down to third man
full outside off, driven firmly to short cover
opens the face and drives this down to third man
starts with a wide ball outside off, cut to point who doesn't field it cleanly but they don't run
short of a length, tighter to off stump, guided to third man...100 up
similar delivery, similar shot but this time Sarfraz can't beat backward point
short of a length, angled in at the batsman, takes inside edge into pad then to the leg side
squares up Malik a little as he looks to work to the leg side
full, on leg stump, flicked off the pads to long leg and they manage it back for a tight(ish) second
starts full outside leg and gets swept away by Sarfraz to fine leg...Sarfraz a good player of spin
uses his feet this time, gets to the pitch and flicks him superbly over midwicket...lovely batting. Challenge is laid down
full at leg stump, worked along the ground through midwicket this time
nearly gets a return catch as Malik drives this
on the pads, flicked to deep square-leg
big turn! This is a lovely delivery, drifted outside leg stump then ripped back to take Sarfraz on the back leg. Completely squared up the batsman
tucks this off the pads to long leg
full outside off, driven to deep cover
back of a length, guided to point
poor ball, short and wide, cut over the off side but straight at deep point
angled down the leg side, that'll be an extra ball
fuller, angling in at the pads, Sarfraz falls across his shot a little
goes after a wide delivery but just gets a bottom edge into the pitch
comes down the pitch, not to the pitch at all, ends up dragging through midwicket
big appeal for lbw, this is a fuller ball which takes the front pad. Hint of it straightening but they decide against the review
swift footwork by Sarfraz and that's a delightful flick wide of mid-on which just beats the dive of Stokes as he comes round from deep midwicket
that's a juicy full toss but only costs a single as it's swept to deep square
goes back and punches to cover
held back a fraction, he's early on his shot and spooned through the covers
flicked to deep square leg
length delivery, defended to midwicket
full at off stump, driven firmly to mid-on
shorter delivery, he goes for the pull but gets taken on the thigh pad instead
nearly drags this on, shaping to angle it to third man and in the ends gets an inside edge to fine leg for a boundary... fifty stand comes up, good recovery
slower ball outside off, 68mph, glided to third man
uses his feet, Dawson drags his length back, tapped to the off side...good cricket
goes back and works off his pads to deep square
sweeps a low full toss and and gets it fine of deep square leg to keep the momentum building
sweeps again, gets it a fraction squarer this time so it is cut off
down the pitch and gets it in the air wide of mid-on, dragged it a little but connected well enough. Bat faced closed
another sweep, very full delivery, out to deep square
superb shot, uses his feet to the quick bowler then drills him over the off side
drags the length back, Sarfraz stays in his crease and angles down to third man
pushes a length delivery wide of a diving midwicket
short of a length, tries to dab it fine but gets it so fine that Bairstow is able to cut it off
very full and wide, called wide
short of a length, tucked out to deep square leg
back of a length, at the stumps, defended to the bowler
goes down early and sweeps off a good length to deep square
goes back to a shorter delivery and cuts through the off side
strong shot down the ground, uses his feet for a couple of steps and smites him straight...simple and very effective
he fires this one, slips down the leg side, not called wide...did it clip the pad? Don't think so
that's even bigger! Miles back over deep midwicket, Dawson getting some treatment...wasn't to the pitch so heaved it over the leg side
worked off the pads to midwicket
starts back of a length outside off and gets pulled to midwicket
gets inside the line and tucks this to long leg
fuller, worked wide of midwicket and placed well enough for a couple
slower ball, 68mph, flicked behind square on the leg side
back of a length, nudged to the leg side...all Pakistan need to do for a while now
short outside off, another slower ball, angled down to third man
full at the stumps, 85mph, defended to the off side
fuller, a slower ball by Wood, and that's a lovely on-drive by Malik who ha settled well into this innings
outside off, 87mph, played square to point
onto the front foot, pushes to the covers, the running has also been much better today
chopped down to third man
short of a length, defended to midwicket
full outside off, 83mph, pushed firmly back to the bowler
works a length delivery in front of square on the leg side
full, wide outside off, driven to deep cover
short ball, gets an under edge as he pulls and it scuttles to the short fine-leg boundary...that's his fifty, and the hundred stand. Excellent stuff
full at the stumps, squeezed past a diving midwicket
on a length at off stump, defended to mid-off
opens the face into the backward point area
nicely timed square through the off side and that brace takes him fifty from 49 balls...very important innings for Malik
direct hit from midwicket! Has Malik made it? Yes, he got a good enough stretch in. Quick job for the third umpire
goes down to sweep Wood, that's brave, but not the first time we've seen him do it to the quicks, sends it to deep square
defended to the covers
shorter delivery, 86mph, gets on top of the bounce and defends to backward point
flicked through midwicket
onto the front foot and pushed square to the covers
neatly worked off his body behind square on the leg side

driven in the air, just wide of short cover, then there's a chance of a run out as Morgan, at mid-off, throws at the striker's end but hits Malik. Half an ask from Bairstow as to whether Malik changed his line of running. But he is fine
short and wide, hammered to deep cover
that's a strong club across the line of a length delivery out to deep midwicket
that's an excellent stroke, back-of-a-length delivery which he threats through the off side behind point and wide of mid-off
a typical run down to third man
short of a length, 87mph, Malik jumps and defends
short and pulled sweetly out to deep square leg
big appeal for lbw as this nips back on a full length and Morgan, perhaps with a bit of a gamble, calls the review. It's in line, but looks a bit high. Yep, going over the stumps
short, pulled over midwicket, not perfectly time but quite safe
thwack! Sarfraz dashes down the track, takes this length ball and dumps it over midwicket. One-bounce four. He held nothing back there
length and outside off, his foot does not ,meet the pitch. The hands reach out, jabbing a drive into the covers
veering down leg. Eased down to long leg
length and angled in, Malik hangs back and flips a single through midwicket
short and wide outside off, Sarfraz flays it in the air over cover
good length and outside off, slices a drive towards point. Jordan loses his footing does well to cut that off with the dive

Change in bowling. Sarfraz says 'it does not matter'. Runs down the track and meatily clubs it over Stokes, who felt the treatment, earlier, for six. Hit over deep midwicket. And that's a one-handed crowd catch. He leant forward from the grandstand and somehow hung on. He gets a high-five from Stokes
Sarfraz steps out again, Woakes drags his length back as the ball bounces over the stumps
Sarfraz waits for this short ball outside off and guides it to third man
now it's Malik's turn to dab a single down to third man
pitched up and outside off, driven out to deep point
length and outside off, deflected to short third man
banged in outside off, Sarfraz unfurls the ramp and sends it to the third man boundary. The fielder in the deep was squarer. Yep, Sarfraz is the man

nudged with an open face to short third man. Sarfraz hunts for a quick single and is sent back as Roy swoops down on the ball and nails a direct hit at the striker's end, they pinch a single off the ricochet
heading down leg, beating the flick and YJB's desperate dive to his left
back of a length and around off, no room, dabbed back at the bowler
full and straight, worked to midwicket
slower ball outside off, sticks in the surface, Malik waits patiently and then cuts through the covers.  Brings up the 150 stand, eliciting applause from coach Arthur
back of a length and curls in a bit, grazes the inside edge and runs down to fine leg
full toss outside off, punched out to wide mid-off
Malik skips out and gets a very short ball, he is struck on the thigh
length and outside off, he stays still and guides it to gully
length and outside off, angled out to gully again
Roy runs in from backward point, takes his eyes off the ball, and allows a single. Tapped away. The fielder was too eager to throw the stumps down
full at off stump, Sarfraz stretches forward and drives it back to the bowler
overpitched and outside off, Malik simply belts it to mid-off
chopped from off stump towards point
beats mid-on to his left. Sarfraz hares down the track, the regular trips down have been the hallmark of his innings. Bashed down the ground
overpitched and outside off, crunched to deep extra cover
length and outside off, Malik secures another single to third man
low full toss on off, tapped down the ground
sliding into the leg stump, brings out the sweep and finds long leg
Sarfraz uses his feet, the debutant held this back on off. Quietly smothered
tossed-up good length ball, turns as well, sweeps again. Pops off the shoulder to slip

Dawson holds his nerve and strikes on ODI debut. Mid-on was in the circle. Sarfraz does not shy away from a challenge. He charges at the left-arm spinning allrounder and goes against the spin. Quicker than the previous delivery, instead of lofting it, he ends up dragging it in the air. Hales judges it superbly. He runs back and takes it over his head. Sarfraz signs off as the leading run-getter in the series. Well done
arm ball, snakes in, defended
Malik goes back and dabs this one to backward point
good length and angling away, opens the face and secures a single to third man. Rizwan gets off the mark
back of a length on middle, turned through midwicket
pitched up on off, forward and blocked back to the bowler
full on middle and leg, pushed to midwicket
picked away off the hips through square leg. Good running, two runs
back of a length and around off, patted to cover
Malik takes a trip outside leg, makes the bowler follow him. He goes low and slogs it away. No protection at deep midwicket
dabbed with the turn to backward point for one
Rizwan likes the sweep as well. Takes it from off, goes low, and drills it square through the leg side
slower through the air on middle, blocked with a straight bat
shot! Malik now races down the track, meets the pitch, and lofts this tossed-up ball ram-rod straight down the ground

Dawson strikes again as Malik's encore fails. Malik steps away outside leg, Dawson gives it some air on the leg stump. Malik looks to loft again. This time he can only skew it off the toe end to long-off
full on off, punchily driven through wide mid-off for four. Crisp timing
back of a length and outside off, chopped to point
length and angled away outside off, played to backward point
back of a length and outside off, jams an inside edge onto the pad
short on middle, looks like a cutter blocked to short extra cover
banged in short on middle, pulled to fine leg
drifts in full on middle, driven down to long-off
looped up and turns into the left-hander, takes the thigh pad
finds some more turn, nurdled to square leg
flighted on middle, sliced drive through point
good-length turning ball, worked past Root at leg slip
good length and turns away outside off, Rizwan plays a wristy drive  through extra cover
full delivery, misjudges the length and goes for a pull. He manages to edge it onto his boot

Bairstow nails a direct hit at the striker's end to catch Nawaz short. This is getting tighter in Cardiff. Heading down leg, deflected off the thigh. The pair chance a leg bye. Bairstow fumbled on the first attempt but recovers. Removes his right glove and hits the stumps with an over-arm throw. This game is slipping out of Pakistan's grasp
length ball on off, defended to cover
length on off, patted to point. Imad chances a single? He decides against it and retreats. The fielder misses the direct hit
fuller than the previous one at off, angled out to point
full and on off and middle, flicked to short midwicket. Rounds off a maiden. Terrific from Willey
pushed through on middle, Rizwan unleashes a firm sweep, sends it square through the leg side
sliding and turning outside off, flashed out to deep point
Imad plays back to this turning ball and deflects it through backward square leg
down the track and driven to long-off
tucked towards square leg
pushed through short and outside off, cut away through backward point
shortish on off, fended towards point
length and outside off, angled down to third man
short and angled away outside off, slashed to backward point
cutter on middle, waits and dabs it down to third man
full on off, guided to backward point
another cutter from Willey, swerves away from the batsman. He plays early and toe-ends a drive towards mid-off
dug in short on off, flaps a pull to mid-on. Imad is struggling but Woakes misses the direct hit
Rizwan is smacked on the box. Another man down. Short on middle, but not as short as the batsman expected, shapes in. Wood goes on laughing. Rizwan composes himself, and he's up
nip-backer on a back of a length, squeezes an inside edge to fine leg
clipped away through midwicket
Rizwan shimmies out and also moves away outside leg, Wood cranks up the pace and hammers a bouncer. Sails over  the hooking batsman to YJB
dug in short on off, Rizwan was camping back, waiting for it. Cracks a pull past the square-leg umpire. The equation is down to 17 off 24
back of a length on middle, leans back and glides it to point
back of a length and outside off, leaden-footed slash finds cover
full and outside off, throws his hands at it and swings to mid-off
dot, dot, dot, four! Back of a length and outside off, he pivots on the back foot and flat-bat wallops it to the right of mid-off
full and outside off, pings a drive, mid-off hunts it down
full on off, driven down to mid-on for one
length and outside off, carved away to cover point
banged in short, he rises on top of it, rolls his wrists and controls a pull over square leg
good length and angling away outside off, patted down to third man
full and outside off, drilled down to mid-off
Wood goes wide of the crease and angles it in on off, Rizwan drives on the up, lands just in front of the bowler, placed it wide of mid-off as well
shortish and outside off. Glided to the right of third man. 300 up for Pakistan
overpitched and outside off, crunched into the covers. Yuvraj-esque drive, that!
Wales-born Imad Wasim wins it for Pakistan in Wales amid rain. Low full toss on the leg stump, hammered away, beating mid-on for a boundary. Jordan's attempted yorker went awry
